name: mannerist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who works in the style of Mannerism (= a movement in 16th-century Italian art): Leading Mannerists include Parmigiano and Giulio Romano, whose pictures are painted in deep, rich colours. She owns a work by a sixteenth-century Mannerist. See
Mannerism
More examplesFewer examplesA drawing by Agnolo Bronzino, the Florentine Mannerist, was found in a box of unidentified scraps.He collects Italian Renaissance and Mannerist prints.The museum will be exhibiting work by important Mannerists in the fall.
